results.title: Above the gorge
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission, Robert Horne and Ken Taylor
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Australia”.
Studies of the Wedge-tailed eagle, Australia’s largest bird, on the Nullarbor Plain in Western Australia, where CSIRO scientists are researching the life-cycle of the eagle, and in Western Victoria where it is regarded as an efficient controller of rabbits. Cinematographer: Keith Taylor.

results.title: Above the dust level [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Scarlett Pictures, Australian Film Commission, Kath Shelper and Carla Drago
results.brief_description: Set against a Sydney backdrop, a hypochondriac, her junkie ex-lover and a neighbour with a life threatening illness are united by dust, allergies and disappearing grey Y-fronts. Cast includes Jane Turner, Tobin Saunders and Melinda Dimitriades. (Awards: Winner of numerous awards, including Best Australian Short Comedy Award, MIFF 1999; Highly Commended, Melbourne Queer Film and Video Festival, 2000; Bronze Award, Houston Film Festival, 2000)

results.title: Above ground iron mine
results.creator_credit: King Screen Productions and Paul Preuss
results.brief_description: An old car reaches the end of the line mechanically, and is sent to the wreckers where it is ground into small bits of iron. These are sent to a smelter where it is processed into structural elements for buildings. We then see the owner of the first car driving a new car - beginning another cycle of use of materials.

results.title: About zoos
results.creator_credit: Films Incorporated, Christine Z Wiser, Harry Rasky and N. H. Cominos
results.brief_description: Edited from the 1970 television special titled Zoos of the world. Explains that modern zoos around the world provide many services for animals, including places where they can graze, dig, climb, swim and sleep with protection and with nursery and medical care. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: About your body. Pt. 2
results.brief_description: Part two of a two-part film using animation and the setting of a doctor’s surgery to discuss the skeletal, muscular, nervous, respiratory, digestive and circulatory systems of the human body. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: About time
results.creator_credit: De Martin - Marona, Robert Marona and Ed De Martin
results.brief_description: Presents the story of a girl and a tree she discovered as a child. Compares this relationship and the paradox of modern man caught in the time squeeze in order to point out the need for man to reorder his values concerning planet Earth.

results.title: About three hundred million years ago...
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Jean Hunt and James Allen
results.brief_description: Shows geologists collecting data to make a geological map and the subsequent laboratory work required to identify the structure and composition of the samples collected. Once the information is compiled, the map can be drawn and ideas about the geological history of the area can be formed. Narrated by Sydney Conabere and photographed by Don Whitehurst. Suitable for upper secondary level.
